abstract: Creates a field node that applies a magnetic force based on the velocity and electrical charge of the physics bodies.
overview:
## Return Value

A new magnetic field node.

## Discussion

The force generated by this field is directed on a line that is determined by calculating the cross-product between the direction of the the physics body’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/velocity] property and a line traced between the field node and the physics body. This field models the second part of the Lorentz equation:

*F = qvB*

Where *F* equals force, *q* equals charge, *v* equals velocity, *B* equals magnetic field and *E* equals electric field.

The force has a magnitude proportional to the field’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKFieldNode/strength] property and the physics body’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/charge] and [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/velocity] properties. Therefore, physics bodies that are either stationary or with a charge of zero will not be affected by a magnetic field. Magnetic fields with a negative strength value impart a clockwise spin on the physics bodies they affect, while a positive strength give a clockwise spin.The [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKFieldNode/falloff] property of a magnetic field node is set by default to `2`.

# magneticField()

**Type Method**

Creates a field node that applies a magnetic force based on the velocity and electrical charge of the physics bodies.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class func magneticField() -> SKFieldNode
```

```swift
class func magneticField() -> SKFieldNode
```

## Return Value

A new magnetic field node.

## Discussion

The force generated by this field is directed on a line that is determined by calculating the cross-product between the direction of the the physics body’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/velocity] property and a line traced between the field node and the physics body. This field models the second part of the Lorentz equation:

*F = qvB*

Where *F* equals force, *q* equals charge, *v* equals velocity, *B* equals magnetic field and *E* equals electric field.

The force has a magnitude proportional to the field’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKFieldNode/strength] property and the physics body’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/charge] and [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/velocity] properties. Therefore, physics bodies that are either stationary or with a charge of zero will not be affected by a magnetic field. Magnetic fields with a negative strength value impart a clockwise spin on the physics bodies they affect, while a positive strength give a clockwise spin.The [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKFieldNode/falloff] property of a magnetic field node is set by default to `2`.

## Creating Field Nodes

- **dragField()**: Creates a field node that applies a force that resists the motion of physics bodies.
- **electricField()**: Creates a field node that applies an electrical force proportional to the electrical charge of physics bodies.
- **linearGravityField(withVector:)**: Creates a field node that accelerates physics bodies in a specific direction.
- **noiseField(withSmoothness:animationSpeed:)**: Creates a field node that applies a randomized acceleration to physics bodies.
- **radialGravityField()**: Creates a field node that accelerates physics bodies toward the field node.
- **springField()**: Creates a field node that applies a spring-like force that pulls physics bodies toward the field node.
- **turbulenceField(withSmoothness:animationSpeed:)**: Creates a field node that applies a randomized acceleration to physics bodies.
- **velocityField(with:)**: Creates a field node that sets the velocity of physics bodies that enter the node’s area based on the pixel values of a texture.
- **velocityField(withVector:)**: Creates a field node that gives physics bodies a constant velocity.
- **vortexField()**: Creates a field node that applies a perpendicular force to physics bodies.
- **customField(evaluationBlock:)**: Creates a field node that calculates and applies a custom force to the physics body.
- **SKFieldForceEvaluator**: The definition for a custom block that processes a single physics body’s interaction with the field.
